intro: Trigonotis hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy trigonotis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy stems and leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Trigonotis hirsuta is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses.
